4942.verse: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

4943.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4944.verse: This is Hell, which the criminals deny.

4945.verse: They will go around between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].

4946.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4947.verse: But for he who has feared the position of his Lord are two gardens -

4948.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

4950.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4951.verse: In both of them are two springs, flowing.

4952.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4953.verse: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.

4954.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4955.verse: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.

4956.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4957.verse: In them are women limiting [their] glances, untouched before them by man or jinni -

4958.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

4959.verse: As if they were rubies and coral.

4960.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4961.verse: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?

4962.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4963.verse: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -

4964.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

4966.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

4967.verse: In both of them are two springs, spouting.

4968.verse: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
